availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Reynolds (Adair County, Kentucky, farmer, sheriff, and liquor dealer)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer, sheriff, and liquor dealer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Holladay Reynolds in Adair County, Kentucky, on October 3, 1844. Father of Susan Reynolds, Lou A. Reynolds, Mary J. Reynolds, Ermine C. Reynolds, John H. Reynolds, Ezly Reynolds, Joseph H. Reynolds, Ella Reynolds, Walter Reynolds, and Bettie Reynolds. Farmer in Adair County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Adair County in 1850. Farmer in Adair County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Adair County in 1860. Sheriff in Adair County in 1861. Sheriff in Adair County in 1862. Liquor dealer in Adair County in 1863.
